summary: Pashto is a language spoken mainly in parts of Pakistan and Afghanistan, with around 40 to 60 million speakers worldwide. It is the native language of the Pashtun people and one of Afghanistan's official languages, along with Dari. In Pakistan, it is widely spoken in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and some parts of Balochistan. Pashto is also significant in Persian literature, often referred to as Afghani. It plays a crucial role in defining the ethnic identity of Pashtuns.
title: Pashto
